bdb9a6fa-d027-11ee-af48-6451065f2a87 false Nova post <Идентификатор>Nova_post <Отключен>false <Порядок>50 <ИсточникСервиса>ТекстоваяСпецификация <Описание>openapi: 3.0.0 servers: - description: production url: 'https://api.novapost.com/v.1.0/' - description: sandbox url: 'https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0/' info: version: 1.0.0 title: API Nova Post description: '

Registration and Obtaining an Access Key:

  • Email servicedesk@novapost.com to register a user for the API.
  • During the registration process, you will receive an API access key. Make sure to store this information in a secure place.

Authentication:

  • Use the received API access key to generate an access key with a lifetime of 1 hour.
  • Use the received access key (JWT-token) for each API request.
  • Authenticate by including the access key in the Authorization header.

Endpoint Definition:

  • Set the endpoint (URL) for accessing the API.
    • https://api.novapost.com/v.1.0 - Production environment
    • https://api-stage.novapost.pl/v.1.0 - Test environment

Documentation Review:

  • Familiarize yourself with the API documentation.
  • Study the available methods, parameters, data formats, usage limitations, and other necessary information for successful interaction with the API.

Request Creation:

  • Formulate your request based on the API documentation.
  • Specify the request method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.), necessary parameters, and data to be sent.

Response Handling:

  • Process the responses from the server.
  • Check the response status code to ensure that the request was successful.
  • Extract and use the necessary data from the API response.

Error Management:

  • Handle possible errors and exceptional situations when working with the API.
  • Pay attention to the error codes and error messages provided by the API to respond appropriately.

It is important to remember that the exact steps and details for connecting to an API may vary depending on the specific API and platform you are working with. Make sure to follow the instructions provided by the API developers and use up-to-date documentation.

' paths: /clients/authorization: get: security: - ApiKeyAuth: [] tags: - Authorization description: >- This API method allows you to generate a temporary JSON Web Token (JWT) that must be added to every subsequent request to ensure proper authentication and authorization. To utilize this method, a personal API key is required. The request for generating a temporary JWT-token should contain your API key as an authentication parameter. Upon a successful request, the response will include the temporary JWT-token, which must be securely stored and included in the header or authentication section of all subsequent requests to access API resources properly. $ref: '#/components/responses/Time-out' summary: Find cargo classifiers (UKT ZED) /shipments: post: security: - JWT: [] tags: - Shipments description: >- Create a Transportation Document. This API method allows you to create a transportation document for deliver from Europe to Ukraine or from Ukraine to Europe with Nova Post. By providing the necessary details, for example such as the origin address in Europe and the destination warehouse in Ukraine, or you can mix other address type, you can generate a document that represents the shipment of goods between the two countries. The response will typically include the generated document's ID and other relevant details. requestBody: description: Optional description in *Markdown* required: true content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: status: type: string description: Status of the document. After the creation of the express waybill the status should be ReadyToShip. There are also possible Draft, Accepted, Deleted, Issued, Returned, Utilized. clientOrder: type: string description: Customer order number. maxLength: 50 nullable: true note: type: string description: Additional information about order. maxLength: 255 payerType: type: string description: Payer for delivery services, with possible values Sender, ThirdPerson, Recipient. payerContractNumber: type: integer description: Contract number or tax identification number (EDRPOU) of the payer for delivery services in case of non-cash payment. Mandatory for the third-party payer option. minLength: 2 maxLength: 20 nullable: true invoice: type: object description: Invoice` block. properties: incoterm: type: string description: International commercial conditions. Usually uses parameters DAP and DDP in international express delivery. currencyCode: type: string description: Currency code to the iso-4217 standerd according to the conditions of the payer contract. Usually uses EUR. pattern: "^[A-Z]{3}$" exportReason: type: string description: Reason for export. For example, ForPersonalPurposes, Other, Selling, Repair, Return. You can find it in dictionary "Find cargo export reasons". nullable: true exportReasonId: type: integer description: ID of reason for export. You can find it in dictionary "Find cargo export reasons". exportReasonNote: type: string description: Additional information about export`s reason. maxLength: 255 exportReasonNoteEng: type: string description: Additional information about export`s reason in English. maxLength: 255 totalCost: type: number description: Total declared value of the items in the invoice in the currency of the sender's country. minimum: 0 maximum: 9999999.99 totalCostEur: type: number description: Total declared value of the items in the invoice in EUR. Calculated automatically. minimum: 0 maximum: 9999999.99 totalCostUsd: type: number description: Total declared value of the items in the invoice in USD. Calculated automatically. minimum: 0 maximum: 9999999.99 items: type: array description: Block of invoice items. Each item can contain several units of the same type of product, the number of units of the product is specified in the amount parameter. items: type: object properties: id: type: string description: ID number. hsCode: type: string description: International standard code used to classify goods crossing a customs border. It must be specified for shippings crossing the border and passing through the customs service. You can find the necessary hsCode in the Cargo Classifiers (UKT ZED) dictionary. maxLength: 255 nullable: true name: type: string description: Name of the item. You can find the necessary name in the Cargo Classifiers (UKT ZED) dictionary. maxLength: 512 nameEng: type: string description: Name of the item in English. maxLength: 512 material: type: string description: Material from which the product is made. Content of the shipping. maxLength: 255 materialEng: type: string description: Material from which the product is made in English. maxLength: 255 madeInCountryCode: type: string description: Country code where the product was made, according to the ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 standard. pattern: "^[A-Z]{2}$" nullable: true actualWeight: type: integer description: Product weight. minimum: 1 maximum: 2147483647 nullable: true measurementCode: type: string description: Units of measurement (e.g. Pieces, Kg, M, Paсkage). maxLength: 255 amount: type: number description: Value in the units of measurement corresponding to the field "measurementCode". minimum: 0 maximum: 9999999.99 cost: type: number description: The cost of this item in the invoice in sender's currency. minimum: 0 maximum: 9999999.99 costUsd: type: number description: The cost of this item in the invoice in USD. Calculated automatically. minimum: 0 maximum: 9999999.99 costEur: type: number description: The cost of this item in the invoice in EUR. Calculated automatically. minimum: 0 maximum: 9999999.99 parcels: type: array description: Parcels` description block. Array contains objects, each object responsible for information about parcel. items: type: object properties: cargoCategory: type: string description: Cargo category (e.g. Parcel, Documents, Cargo). parcelDescription: type: string description: A brief description of the contents of the package. maxLength: 255 insuranceCost: type: number description: The declared value of the shipment, which determines the insured amount. minimum: 0 rowNumber: type: integer description: Number of a subpackage. If the shipment contains only one package, the value should be 1. minimum: 1 width: type: integer description: The actual width of the parcel in mm. minimum: 1 length: type: integer description: The actual length of the parcel in mm. minimum: 1 height: type: integer description: The actual height of the parcel in mm. minimum: 1 actualWeight: type: integer description: The actual weight of the parcel in grams. minimum: 0 maximum: 2147483647 sender: type: object description: Information about the sender. Parameter contains a few variables to describe person or organization who sending cargo (cargo owner). properties: companyTin: type: string description: The tax identifier of the sender's counterparty (EDRPOU, TIN, NIP), in case the sender is a legal entity. An empty parameter if the sender is not a company. maxLength: 20 nullable: true companyName: type: string description: Company name, in case the sender is a legal entity. "Private person" - if the sender is not a company. maxLength: 100 nullable: true phone: type: string description: The phone number of the sender or the representative of the company, if it is a legal entity. pattern: "[0-9]{8,15}$" email: type: string description: Sender`s e-mail. name: type: string description: Last and First name of the sender or company representative, if it is a legal entity. maxLength: 100 countryCode: type: string description: Short code of the sender's country to the ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 standard. For example, PL. pattern: "^[A-Z]{2}$" divisionNumber: type: integer description: Division number in case of sending from the postoffice. nullable: true addressParts: type: object description: Sender's address in case of sending from the address. Parameter contains a few variables to describe sender`s pick up address or other place beside warehouses. properties: city: type: string description: City or town name, only for sending from address. Proper name can be used from settlement request. maxLength: 100 region: type: string description: City region name, only for sending from address. Proper name can be used from settlement request. maxLength: 100 street: type: string description: Street name, only for sending from address. maxLength: 100 postCode: type: integer description: Postal code. Symbols that specifies address for a proper sort of cargo, only for sending from address. maxLength: 10 building: type: string description: Building number, only for sending from address. maxLength: 100 flat: type: string description: Apartment number, only for sending from address. maxLength: 10 block: type: string description: Block, only for sending from address. maxLength: 100 nullable: true note: type: string description: Additional information about sender`s address in case of sending from the address. maxLength: 100 recipient: type: object description: Information about the recipient. Parameter contains a few variables to describe person or organization who must receive cargo. properties: companyTin: type: string description: TIN of the company, in case the sender is a legal entity. Empty parameter if sender not a company. maxLength: 20 nullable: true companyName: type: string description: Company name, in case the sender is a legal entity. Private person - if sender not a company. maxLength: 100 nullable: true phone: type: string description: The phone number of the recipient or the representative of the company, if it is a legal entity. When creating shipments to NovaPost divisions, you can specify phone numbers of Ukrainian mobile operators. If shipments are made to the offices of partners, InPost, GLS, Venipak, Cargus, etc., or to addresses in different countries, the recipient's phone number must be indicated by the mobile operator of the recipient's country. pattern: "[0-9]{8,15}$" email: type: string description: Recipient`s E-mail. name: type: string description: Surname and first name of the recipient or representative of the company, if it is a legal entity. maxLength: 100 countryCode: type: string description: Code of the recipient's country to the ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 standard. For example, UA. pattern: "^[A-Z]{2}$" divisionNumber: type: integer description: Division number in case of delivering to the postoffice. nullable: true addressParts: type: object description: Recipient's address in case of sending to the address. Parameter contains a few variables to describe recipient`s delivery address or other place beside warehouses. properties: city: type: string description: City or town name, only for address delivery. Proper name can be used from settlement request. maxLength: 100 region: type: string description: City region name, only for address delivery. Proper name can be used from settlement request. summary: Update document delete: security: - JWT: [] tags: - Shipments description: >- This API method allows you to delete a transportation document by providing its unique document ID. By specifying the document ID in the request, you can remove the corresponding document from the system. The response will typically indicate the success of the deletion operation. parameters: - name: id in: path description: Transportation document id. required: true schema: type: integer format: int32 example: 12345 responses: '200': description: shipments content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: deletedAt: type: string description: Datetime when the document was deleted. example: '{ "deletedAt": "2023-04-18T11:47:19.290462Z" } ' '401': $ref: '#/components/responses/Unauthorized' '404': $ref: '#/components/responses/NotFound' '422': $ref: '#/components/responses/Validation' '503': $ref: '#/components/responses/Time-out' summary: Delete document /shipments/print: get: security: - JWT: [] tags: - Shipments description: >- This API method allows you to retrieve a transportation document marking in PDF format by providing the document number. The document marking is a printable document that clients can attach or affix to their cargo when sending it. By specifying the document number in the request, you can generate a PDF file containing the document marking for easy printing. parameters: - in: query name: 'numbers[]' description: Shipment`s numbers. Can accept either a single number or an array of numbers. schema: type: string example: SHPL1234567890 - in: query name: type description: Selection of document type. schema: type: array items: type: string enum: - marking - international - invoice - in: query name: printSizeType description: Selection of document size. schema: type: array items: type: string enum: - size_100_100 - size_A4 - in: query name: copies description: Quantity of copies. schema: type: number responses: '200': description: A PDF file. content: application/pdf: schema: type: string format: binary '401': $ref: '#/components/responses/Unauthorized' '404': $ref: '#/components/responses/NotFound' '422': $ref: '#/components/responses/Validation' '503': $ref: '#/components/responses/Time-out' summary: Print documents /shipments/tracking/history: get: security: - JWT: [] tags: - Shipments description: >- This API method enables you to retrieve the status of a shipment by providing the transportation document number. By specifying the document number in the request, you can obtain information about the current location or status of the shipment, providing clients with real-time updates on the progress of their cargo. parameters: - in: query name: 'numbers[]' description: Shipment`s numbers. Can accept either a single number or an array of numbers. schema: type: string example: SHPL1234567890 responses: '200': description: shipments content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: items: type: array description: Array of items in the invoice. items: type: object properties: id: type: string description: Transportation document id. number: type: string description: Transportation document number. history_tracking: type: array description: Array of tracking history statuses for the specified shipment. items: type: object properties: code: type: string description: Tracking status code number. code_name: type: string description: Tracking status name. country_code: type: string description: Country code for the place where tracking status was created. settlement: type: string description: City name for the place where tracking status was created. date: type: string description: Datetime when tracking status was created. example: items: - id: '111003' number: SHPL2326420334 history_tracking: - code: '1' code_name: Zamówienie zostało utworzone.
